intro: Plagiobothrys tenellus subvar. humifusus, commonly known as the lowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in terminal clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or disturbed areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
